primevc.core.Bindable

type
class
implements
primevc.core.traits.IClonable<Bindable<DataType>>
IBindable<DataType>
Class to keep a value automatically updated. You can trigger another bindable to update by doing: var a = new Bindable (5); var b = new Bindable (6); a.bind(b); //a will be 6 now b.value = 8; //a will be 8 now You can also create a two way binding by doing: a.pair(b); Which is effictively the same as doing: a.bind(b); b.bind(a); //will not create an infinte loop ;-) You can trigger a method when the property is changed: using primevc.utils.BindUtil; function updateLabel (newLabel:String) : Void { textField.text = newLabel; } var a = new Bindable ("aap"); updateLabel.on( a.change, this ); a.value = "2 apen"; //textField.text will also be changed now The 'change' event will be dispatched after 'this.value' changes.

Constructor

new(?val : DataType)

Instance Variables

change(default,null) : primevc.core.dispatcher.Signal2<DataTypeOldValue<DataType>>

Dispatched just before "value" is set to a new value. Signal argument: The new value.

value(default,setValue) : DataType

Instance Methods

bind(otherBindable : IBindableReadonly<DataType>) : Void

Makes sure this.value is (and remains) equal to otherBindable's value. In other words: - update this when otherBindable.value changes

clone() : Bindable<DataType>

dispose() : Void

inline isEmpty() : Bool

pair(otherBindable : IBindable<DataType>) : Void

Makes sure this Bindable and otherBindable always have the same value. In other words: - update this when otherBindable.value changes - update otherBindable when this.value changes

inline set(val : DataType) : Void

Sets value directly, without the requirement to be in edit mode, and without dispatching any events.

inline toString() : String

unbind(otherBindable : IBindableReadonly<DataType>) : Bool

see
IBindableReadonly
